intro: Adicea centradenioides, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often cultivated for its ornamental value. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive. Adicea centradenioides is known for its ability to produce vibrant blooms in shades of purple, pink, and white.
